section.title: Definition
section.para: Contains basic information about the distribution necessary for SystemBuilder to complete an appliance build.

listitem.para: The microprocessor architecture label for the target distribution machines. Accepts either "i386" or "x86_64".
Throughout this document, the text value of this element is referred to by $ARCH.
This element is required.
TEXT specifying a way for client system users to report appliance installation bugs.
The default value is "No bug url provided".
Copyright TEXT for the appliance.
The default value is the empty string ("").

note.para: Be sure to use standard XML encoding for other characters as well, if necessary.

listitem.para: A human-friendly name for the appliance.
The default value is $NAME.
The unique id for the custom appliance. This value is also the directory name for the final published appliance build folder within the build cache.
The default value is $NAME-$VERSION-$ARCH.
Throughout this document, the text value of this element is referred to by $SYSTEMID.
The PATH to the applianceâ€™s build log file.
The default value is /var/log/systembuilder.log.
The name of the target appliance.
Throughout this document, the text value of this element is referred to by $NAME.
This element is required.
The name of the directory within the final output distribution tree where SystemBuilder will place packages.
The default value is Packages.
The version of the target appliance.
Throughout this document, the text value of this element is referred to by $VERSION.
This element is required.

informalexample.programlisting: <main> <name>samba-server</name> <version>5</version> <arch>i386</arch> <fullname>CentOS Samba Server</fullname> <bug-url>http://www.example.com/bugs</bug-url> <copyright>©2008, Example Company, All Rights Reserved.</copyright> <log-file>/home/systembuilderuser/SPIN/eg_CentOS5_main.log</log-file> </main>
